heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 04 September 2025 and lasted 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwave.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwave in progress.  So far, 6 heatwaves have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (179°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 55.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 13 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 3.7°C), dew point temperature (up 2.7°C), inside temperature (up 1.7°C), and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 373.2m higher than yesterday, 648.1m higher than the past week, 336.6m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 767m to a maximum of 3570m, averaging 2230m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1577.6m and 2560m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; temperatures should feel nicely warm. Also, humidity should not be a concern and winds will be practically absent. Possible light showers, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Similar weather conditions should remain.
